This this year and now Murphy Brown is back Twenty years after the Emmy winning sitcom went off the air CBS has revived it for an eleventh season Candice Bergen plays the older but still fast talking broadcast journalist who returns alongside the original cast NPR TV critic Eric Deggans joins us to talk about it higher Rick
Hey so Murphy Brown was always about mining politics for entertainment back in the day I'd had fans from both sides of the aisle Senator Orrin hatch Republican of Utah even sending the head shot hoping to make a guest appearances do you think it could have crossover appeal today or are they even making an effort now
In one word or you know I spoke to the show's creator and show runner Diane English in LA in July
And basically she told me she didn't think there would be a show 'em there would be a revival or if if Trump hadn't been elected president
Um she was a how supportive of Hillary Clinton ran a pack um that was connected to her before the election had a huge party at our house ah ah for the election and had like two hundred bottles of champagne that she could no been when a Hillary Clinton didn't win














Of this a revival I I didn't I found some of the humor to be I'm kind of old fashioned and and some of the speech fine by the Murphy Brown character to be kind of a diabetic
And in your face in a way that that uh that wasn't necessarily entertaining and and this bit at the end of the first episode the revival felt like wishful thinking in a way like like like you you like you kinda wish the show 'em ... these people making a kind of wish the show would be impossible enough
That Donald Trump would actually watch it and sort of treated them a while I was going on so uh so they actually made it happen within the confines of the show but
Um what's really happening is that there are so many people that had been saying things like this for so long on television including most of the late night uh comedians that we have you know Steven ... Jimmy Kimmel and
Ah Trevor Noah that uh it doesn't really feel like Murphy Brown is saying anything new um when when the show was originally doing this kind of commentary
Uh it's still different because there weren't a lot of shows that we're talking this way and there weren't a lotta sitcoms that were caught talking very directly about things that were happening in the world now all of that has changed and I think his left Murphy Brown feeling a little out of step with the times

Yeah um I mean in a way this could feel like a like a step too far uh some some of the other ... boots I'm from the way the viewers responded to them you had a sense that there was sort of a a pin up demand amongst fans when Roseanne came back
Whatever you think of star was embers politics um there's the audience responded by paying attention to the show and you had the sense that
Uh fans had kind of missed it and and with will and grace and NBC that revive all the same thing now CBS is a little different CBS has done a lotta revivals of shows
That are sort of thinly veiled or revivals you know they have ... magnum PI they have ... they have mcgyver and all of these are just kind of an excuse to take really predictable and run of the mill or procedural adventure stories and ... and slapped living near the show ... over it so
Um you know those have been under the radar and the way they get decent ratings but they're not the kind of phenomenon that will and grace
And um and and Roseanne where I think CBS was trying to do that kinda phenomenon with Murphy Brown
And we're familiar with the show and because the the the ... version of it I'm Still a little awkward in kind of old school I I think it's going to have a hard time finding

Alexandra less God's graduated from the national cathedral school in Nineteen eighty eight with many memories she wishes she could forget
There was a drunk girl in a room um and there was a boy in there with her and there were other boys lined up outside the door and my friend recalls hearing I'm next time next
It was such a toxic culture of power and privilege she says many guys didn't even try to hide it and schools knew how bad it was
